attributes.action: Financial controls on professional football players' wages
attributes.additional_details: With the large amounts that most footballers get paid each week, it would make sense to cap the amount they actually get in cash (as a fixed amount, not a percentage), and force the remainder to be paid into a trust fund, which would be payable when the player retires (either through age or injury).  This trust fund could be paid as a weekly/monthly amount or lump sum if to buy property.  This would bring footballers onto a more sensible living amount without penalisation.
